pyecharts.charts.basic_charts.sunburst
======================================

.. py:module:: pyecharts.charts.basic_charts.sunburst


Classes
-------

.. autoapisummary::

   pyecharts.charts.basic_charts.sunburst.Sunburst


Module Contents
---------------

.. py:class:: Sunburst(init_opts: pyecharts.types.Init = opts.InitOpts(), render_opts: pyecharts.types.RenderInit = opts.RenderOpts())

   Bases: :py:obj:`pyecharts.charts.chart.Chart`


   <<< Sunburst >>

   Sunburst graphs are composed of multiple layers of ring graphs.
   In terms of data structure, inner circle is the parent node of outer circle.
   Therefore, it can represent local and global proportions like pie charts and
   hierarchical relationships like rectangle tree graphs.


   .. py:method:: add(series_name: str, data_pair: pyecharts.types.Sequence, *, center: pyecharts.types.Optional[pyecharts.types.Sequence] = None, radius: pyecharts.types.Optional[pyecharts.types.Sequence] = None, highlight_policy: str = 'descendant', node_click: str = 'rootToNode', sort_: pyecharts.types.Optional[pyecharts.types.JSFunc] = 'desc', is_render_label_for_zero_data: bool = False, is_clockwise: bool = True, start_angle: pyecharts.types.Numeric = 90, levels: pyecharts.types.Optional[pyecharts.types.Sequence[pyecharts.types.SunburstLevelOpts]] = None, label_opts: pyecharts.types.Label = opts.LabelOpts(), label_line_opts: pyecharts.types.SunburstLabelLine = None, label_layout_opts: pyecharts.types.SunburstLabelLayout = None, itemstyle_opts: pyecharts.types.ItemStyle = None, tooltip_opts: pyecharts.types.Tooltip = None, emphasis_opts: pyecharts.types.Emphasis = None)
